pull_request.title: Send email on account update
pull_request.body:
<!--
NOTE: We are in the middle of a big redesign of the frontend.
That could mean that your PR will not get through on the next few months.
Please see https://github.com/decidim/decidim/discussions/9512
-->

#### :tophat: What? Why?
This PR sends the notification email to the user, with an information about all of the fields that has been updated.


#### :pushpin: Related Issues
*Link your PR to an issue*
- Related to #?
- Fixes #9859 

#### Testing
Run the test as you would do normally

### :camera: Screenshots
*Please add screenshots of the changes you are proposing*
The typical email looks like this:
![image](https://github.com/decidim/decidim/assets/104360479/7f395378-4624-444c-8240-0143b6c57400)


:hearts: Thank you!

repo.name: decidim
repo.description: The participatory democracy framework. A generator and multiple gems made with Ruby on Rails

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+# frozen_string_literal: true
+
+module Decidim
+  class UserUpdateMailer < ApplicationMailer
+    def notify(user, updates)
+      with_user(user) do
+        @user = user
+        @organization = user.organization
+        @updates = format_array(updates)
+        mail(to: user.email, subject: I18n.t(
+          "decidim.user_update_mailer.subject"
+        ))
+      end
+    end
+
+    private
+
+    def format_array(updates)
+      case updates.length
+      when 1
+        updates.first
+      when 2
+        "#{updates.first} and #{updates.last}"
+      else
+        "#{updates[0..-2].join(", ")}, and #{updates.last}"
+      end
+    end
comment.body:
Thanks for the suggest,
I've already made the changes with a similar strategy

issue.title: Make initiatives print disabled by default

labels.name: type: change
labels.description: PRs that implement a change for an existing feature

issue.body:
#### :tophat: What? Why?

On one of the last @decidim/product meetings we agreed that having the Initiatives print flow enabled by default is weird, as that's a use case specific to Barcelona and we think that's not directly applicable to most of the others organizations. 

This PR disables it by default. 
 

#### Testing

This should not be enabled by default
All the specs should pass 

 
:hearts: Thank you!

comment.body: @alecslupu this is ready for another round whenever you have the time

review.body: As I said, there are some things that were broken in the redesign but as this is strictly related to the Bulletin Board integration it's 🆗 as is

pull_request.title: Use Bulletin Board latest packages and apply basic fixes
pull_request.body:
Updates the Bulletin Board gem to the last working version (0.24.4) that uses ElectionGuard 1.2.3.

Adds small fixes to avoid Javascript errors due to unnecessary processing on some places.

Locks `"graphql", "~> 2.0.0"` due a client incompatibility with verision 2.1. See https://github.com/github/graphql-client/pull/310

review.body:
I'm just focusing in the connection with the BB, using the default keys and so on.

I'm ignoring all the problems introduced by the redesign. 

As far as I could test with the Trustees creation, it seems like it's working OK. 

There are some missing ports change to be done so we don't break the docker-compose configurations. Can you change them please?

+# frozen_string_literal: true

+module Decidim
+  class UserUpdateMailer < ApplicationMailer
+    def notify(user, updates)
+      with_user(user) do
+        @user = user
+        @organization = user.organization
+        @updates = format_array(updates)
+        mail(to: user.email, subject: I18n.t(
+          "decidim.user_update_mailer.subject"
+        ))
+      end
+    end
+
+    private
+
+    def format_array(updates)
+      case updates.length
+      when 1
+        updates.first
+      when 2
+        "#{updates.first} and #{updates.last}"
+      else
+        "#{updates[0..-2].join(", ")}, and #{updates.last}"
+      end
+    end

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,25 +6,42 @@ module Comments
     # to Seed those models in order to be able to use them in the development
     # app.
     class Seed
-      # Public: adds a random amount of comments for a given resource.
-      #
-      # resource - the resource to add the coments to.
-      #
-      # Returns nothing.
-      def self.comments_for(resource)
-        return unless resource.accepts_new_comments?
+      class << self
+        # Adds a random amount of comments for a given resource.
+        #
+        # @param resource [Object] - the Decidim resource to add the coments to.
+        #                            examples: Decidim::Proposals::CollaborativeDraft, Decidim::Proposals::Proposal,
+        #
+        # @return nil
+        def comments_for(resource)
+          return unless resource.accepts_new_comments?
 
-        Decidim::Comments::Comment.reset_column_information
+          Decidim::Comments::Comment.reset_column_information
 
-        organization = resource.organization
+          rand(0..6).times do
+            comment = create_comment(resource)
+            create_comment(comment, resource) if [true, false].sample
+          end
+        end
+
+        private
 
-        2.times do
-          author = Decidim::User.where(organization:).all.sample
+        # Creates a comment for a given resource.
+        #
+        # @private
+        #
+        # @param resource [Object] - the Decidim resource to add the coments to.
+        #                            examples: Decidim::Proposals::CollaborativeDraft, Decidim::Proposals::Proposal,
+        # @param root_commentable [Decidim::Comments::Comment|nil] - the root commentable resource. It is optional, used for making nested comments.
comment.body:
When there is a root comment, The root commentable and commentable types are resources ( Proposals ) 
When there is a reply, the commentable is a Comment, the root commentable is a resource ( like Proposal ).

```suggestion
        # @param resource [Object] - the Decidim resource to add the comments to.
        # @param root_commentable - the root commentable resource. It is optional, used for making nested comments.
```

pull_request.title: Add replies to comments in seeds
pull_request.body:
#### :tophat: What? Why?
 
From time to time we need to check for comments replies during development (see #11829). This PR adds replies to comments in seeds. 

#### Testing

1. Regenerate seeds with `bin/rails db:drop db:create db:migrate db:seed `
2. Go to a proposals index in a process and go to a proposal with lots of comments

### :camera: Screenshots

![Screenshot of a proposal with seeded comments](https://github.com/decidim/decidim/assets/717367/e4ce2001-d72b-4240-b3c3-e4bc6973501a)


:hearts: Thank you!

issue.title: Remove duplicate CSS class in the password field

labels.name: type: fix
labels.description: PRs that implement a fix for a bug

issue.body:
#### :tophat: What? Why?
Unnecessary css class stretched the login form

### :camera: Screenshots
[Screencast from 25-10-23 15_14_52.webm](https://github.com/decidim/decidim/assets/817526/48eadde8-d5ae-43cf-9893-d00e5c41f2a6)

:hearts: Thank you!

comment.body: That's right. I've removed an unnecessary css class that separate both blocks (mainly it created a divider), when actually they must belong to the same "section" of change password

issue.title: Redesign: margin for comments

labels.name: type: fix
labels.description: PRs that implement a fix for a bug

issue.body:
#### :tophat: What? Why?
Include margin for comments in mobile

### :camera: Screenshots
Before:
![imagen](https://github.com/decidim/decidim/assets/817526/6853b1cc-3e8d-484f-9369-1d6a4df82cee)

After:
![imagen](https://github.com/decidim/decidim/assets/817526/6c005a32-1cec-4697-8f7b-5e322af335ac)


:hearts: Thank you!

comment.body:
Ok, sure.

Just for the record, meeting and proposals (and most of the resources) use the *layout_item* type, however, blogs do not. Blogs is using the *layout-1col* (as the most of the forms, but not the resource items). Therefore, it does not apply the same section/spacing stuff, i.e the css behind the scenes is different.

I'll make equal both gaps, good catch! :)

+            create_comment(comment, resource) if [true, false].sample
comment.body:
I think this should be like this ... When you load the Seeds you actually get a lot of empty "Hide replies" buttons.
Also the below docs explaining that root commentable should be a comment, not a resource
```suggestion
            create_comment( resource, comment) if [true, false].sample
```

From time to time we need to check for comments replies during development (see #11829). This PR adds replies to comments in seeds.

2. Go to a proposals index in a process and go to a proposal with lots of comments

pull_request.title: Disable rich text editor for participants when creating a new proposal
pull_request.body:
#### :tophat: What? Why?
When I have disabled the "Enable rich text editor for participants" option, the proposal template is displayed with HTML tags.
 
I have completed the acceptance criteria:
Given that I'm a global administrator
and I've disabled the "Enable rich text editor for participants"
When I go to "Template for the text of a new proposal" in the proposals component configuration of a participatory process
Then I shouldn't see the rich text editor in this field.

#### :pushpin: Related Issues
- Related to  #7034

#### Testing
Within manage proposals settings example:
   When rich text editor is enabled:
      - shows the rich text editor in the body template setting
   When the rich text editor is disabled: 
      - does not show the rich text editor in the body template setting
Within new proposals: 
 When creating a new proposal:
    When rich text editor is enabled for participants
        - displays text with rich text in the input body
    When the rich text editor is disabled for participants
        - does not display HTML tags in the body template
### :camera: Screenshots
![image](https://github.com/decidim/decidim/assets/116598037/83a44a97-4e37-4353-8650-1af469d211c8)


:hearts: Thank you!
